paper.title: Phase-curve Evidence for an Atmosphere on TRAPPIST-1 b

core_question: Does the Earth-sized rocky exoplanet TRAPPIST-1 b retain an atmosphere, as inferred from JWST MIRI phase-curve thermal spectroscopy and structure near the 15 um CO2 band?

datasets_or_cohorts.label: JWST MIRI phase-curve spectroscopy
datasets_or_cohorts.sample_size_or_observations: Phase-resolved thermal spectra over one orbital phase curve of TRAPPIST-1 b
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Low-resolution JWST/MIRI spectroscopy taken over the planet's orbital phase, measuring thermal flux variations and spectral structure across the orbit.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: No-atmosphere (bare-rock) null scenario
datasets_or_cohorts.sample_size_or_observations: Model comparison case (airless planet; minimal heat redistribution)
datasets_or_cohorts.description: An atmosphere-free, bare-rock forward model used as a null hypothesis, representing the no-redistribution limit for the phase curve and spectrum.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: CO2-rich atmosphere retrieval family
datasets_or_cohorts.sample_size_or_observations: Retrieval scenarios including a 0.3â€“1.0 bar pressure branch
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Atmosphere-bearing retrieval models emphasizing CO2 greenhouse absorption (including the 15 um band) and exploring moderate-pressure solutions.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: O2-rich atmosphere retrieval family
datasets_or_cohorts.sample_size_or_observations: Retrieval scenarios with oxidized compositions and weaker CO2 constraints
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Alternative atmosphere-bearing retrieval models with an O2-rich composition, which are discussed as not being fully excluded by current observations.

major_limitations: Single-planet study; does not establish atmospheric prevalence across rocky M-dwarf planets.
Quantitative retrieval posteriors depend on assumptions about circulation, opacity priors, and clouds.
Stellar variability and instrument systematics may bias weak spectral features.
Night-side constraints are weaker than day-side constraints in the current dataset.
